SEARCH
Package librarySE.core

Class EmailService

java.lang.Object
librarySE.core.EmailService
public class EmailService extends Object
Provides a lightweight email-sending utility backed by Gmail’s SMTP service.

EmailService loads Gmail credentials from a local .env file using the java-dotenv library and sends plain-text email notifications using a secure TLS-enabled SMTP connection.

Responsibilities

  • Load Gmail username and app-password from environment file
  • Configure and authenticate an SMTP session
  • Send text-based email messages

Required .env File

The service expects a valid Gmail app-password (not a regular password). 


 EMAIL_USERNAME=your_email@gmail.com
 EMAIL_PASSWORD=your_app_password

Usage Example


 EmailService mail = new EmailService();
 mail.sendEmail("student@najah.edu", "Reminder", "Your book is overdue.");

Errors during SMTP communication are surfaced as RuntimeExceptions and also written to the system logger for debugging.

Author:
Eman

  • Constructor Details

    • EmailService

      public EmailService()
      Constructs an EmailService and loads Gmail credentials from the project's .env file.

      Uses java-dotenv to read environment variables without exposing sensitive credentials directly in the source code.

  • Method Details

    • sendEmail

      public void sendEmail(String to, String subject, String body)
      Sends a plain-text email message through Gmail’s SMTP server.

      SMTP Details:

      • Host: smtp.gmail.com
      • Port: 587 (TLS)
      • Authentication: Required
      • STARTTLS: Enabled
      Parameters:
      to - recipient email address
      subject - message subject line
      body - plain-text body content
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the email cannot be sent
